result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jury status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:56 PM; Case called for Plea hearing.  Defendant Marcus T Roberts in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires how the matter will be proceeding today.  Atty. Sonderhouse advises that his client does not want to proceed with a plea today and wants to keep the matter set for trial.  Court notes the matter is currently set for jury trial on 6/21/22 and all other matters are tagging along with for status.  Atty. Zilavy advises that as she believed the matters were going to resolve she did not file a Joinder Motion, but now that they are not resolving she advises she does plan to file a Joinder Motion.  Based on that motion and if granted by the Court Atty. Zilavy believes that the trial itself would now take a week, not 2 days as previously scheduled.  Atty. Zilavy also notes that as the matter is not being resolved today the State is withdrawing their offer, and she is asking that the jury trial be rescheduled.  Court recommends setting just the cases that the State intends to join together on one date, and all the other matters keeping scheduled for their current dates in June to try to resolve them.  State has no objection to the Court's recommendations.  Defense has no objections.  Court will set 21CM1592 for jury status on 6/19/22 at 9:30 with a jury trial on 6/21/22 for 1 Day; all other matters will tag along with for possible plea and sentencing.  Court will then schedule all other matters, except 21CM1592, for a new jury status and trial dates with the understanding that the State will file a Joinder Motion and it will be granted by the Court.  State must file their Joinder Motion by 05/24/2022; IF filed the Court will hear the motion at the 6/19/2022 Jury status date.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
